paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses a frameshift mutation in the BRCA2 gene and its effects on male fertility in a rat model.

functional_data.summary: The frameshift mutation leads to increased DNA double-strand breaks and apoptosis in testicular germ cells, resulting in male subfertility.

variants.segregation_data: The homozygous mutants were embryonic lethal, and the heterozygous mutants developed normally but exhibited reproductive dysfunction.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on functional assays and phenotypic outcomes.
variants.additional_notes: The study emphasizes the importance of considering reproductive capacity in BRCA2 carriers.
key_quotes: The heterozygous mutants developed normally but exhibited increased DNA DSBs and apoptosis in testicular germ cells, along with deteriorating sperm quality as they aged, ultimately leading to early reproductive dysfunction.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on a specific BRCA2 variant.
